definitions.definition: used to form a negative phrase after verbs like "be", "can", "have", "will", "must", etc., usually used in the short form "n't" in speech:
used to give the next word or group of words a negative meaning:
examples: I told you not to do that.

definitions.definition: used after verbs like "be afraid", "hope", "suspect", etc. in short, negative replies:
examples: "Is he coming with us?" "I hope not."

definitions.definition: used to say what the situation will be if something does not happen:
examples: I hope to see you there but, if not, I'll call you.

definitions.definition: used to express the possibility that something might not happen:
examples: Are you going to reply or not?

definitions.definition: sometimes used at the end of a statement to show that you did not mean what you have said:
examples: That was the best meal I've ever had - not!
